(flush, DCacheMiss).explanation: Pipeline flushes can cause data cache misses because when the pipeline is flushed, the processor may need to re-fetch data that was previously in the cache hierarchy, potentially leading to cache misses if that data has been evicted;

(flush, ICacheMiss).explanation: Pipeline flushes directly cause instruction cache misses because when the pipeline is flushed due to branch mispredictions or exceptions, the processor must restart instruction fetching from a new address, often resulting in instruction cache misses;

(flush, flush).explanation: A variable cannot have a causal relationship with itself as this would represent a logical impossibility in causal modeling;
